item.title: What Googlebot's 2MB Crawl Size Limit Means For SEO
item.content:encoded: Google limits how much HTML content it processes when crawling a page. Learn what the 2MB file size limit means for SEO and how to diagnose large HTML documents.

item.title: Mobile performance: How to make your website mobile friendly
item.content:encoded: Learn why websites often feel slow on mobile devices—even when they perform well on desktop. This article explains the difference between actual and perceived performance, highlights the most common mobile performance bottlenecks, and outlines practical, real-world optimization strategies based on modern web performance best practices and Core Web Vitals.

item.title: A Web Performance Analysis Of Consent Management Platforms
item.content:encoded: An analysis of the most commonly used Consent Management Platforms and their impact on Interaction to Next Paint.

item.title: The Complete Guide To Ecommerce SEO in 2026
item.content:encoded: Learn how to optimize your ecommerce website for search engines in 2026. This guide covers keyword research, site architecture, technical SEO, Core Web Vitals, and strategies for AI-powered search.

item.title: What is JPEG XL: do we really need another image format?
item.content:encoded: Learn what JPEG XL is, how it compares to other image formats like AVIF and WebP, and whether you should use it on your website.

item.title: React Compiler: An Introduction, Pros, Cons & When to Use It
item.content:encoded: React Compiler helps optimize React performance by automatically memoizing your app, which can improve your Interaction to Next Paint (INP) scores, eliminate unnecessary re-renders, and make your code cleaner.

item.title: How Web Performance Impacts User Experience
item.content:encoded: Learn how website speed impacts user experience and how you can measure performance and business outcomes.

item.title: Improve React Performance With useMemo And useCallback
item.content:encoded: Learn how to optimize React application performance using useMemo and useCallback. This article explains when memoization truly matters, highlights common performance pitfalls, and provides practical examples and best practices—along with references to real-world React performance guidelines used by modern teams.

item.title: How To Diagnose Lighthouse Score Discrepancies Between Tools
item.content:encoded: Learn why Lighthouse scores differ between tools like PageSpeed Insights and Chrome DevTools, and how to diagnose and fix these discrepancies.

item.title: How to Measure and Optimize React Performance
item.content:encoded: Learn how to measure the performance of your React app and identify what's slowing it down.

item.title: We Fixed A 6-Year-Old JavaScript Memory Leak
item.content:encoded: How we discovered and fixed a lodash memoize memory leak that caused out of memory crashes in our Google Cloud Functions.

item.title: How We Made DebugBear Better In 2025
item.content:encoded: Learn how we've improved real user monitoring, synthetic testing, and team collaboration.

item.title: Firefox And Safari Now Support Two Core Web Vitals Metrics
item.content:encoded: Firefox and Safari now support LCP and INP Core Web Vitals metrics, providing new insight into real visitor experience.

item.title: A Website Performance Review Of The Splunk Homepage
item.content:encoded: Take a look at Core Web Vitals on a real website to see how it could be optimized.

item.title: Next.js Image Optimization
item.content:encoded: Learn how to optimize images in Next.js using the next/image component. Discover best practices for responsive images, lazy loading, and improving Core Web Vitals with automatic image optimization.

item.title: 2025 In Review: What’s New In Web Performance?
item.content:encoded: Find out how web performance changed in 2025, and what changes are coming up in the future.

item.title: Calendly Booking Links: A Web Performance Audit
item.content:encoded: We take a look at a real-world website to investigate what's slowing it down and how it could be optimized.

item.title: How Quickly Can Chrome Parse HTML Code?
item.content:encoded: HTML parsing speed speed depends on the processing power of the visitor's device. I collected two quick datapoints.

item.title: How To Debug JavaScript In Chrome DevTools
item.content:encoded: Learn how to set pause execution, inspect application state, and discover advanced breakpoint functionality.

item.title: How To Throttle Specific Requests In Chrome DevTools
item.content:encoded: Learn how to delay individual requests in Chrome DevTools. Debug performance issues or bugs that happen when specific resources are delayed.
